availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John C. Henson (Marion, Kentucky, hotel keeper.)

body.p: Marion, Kentucky, hotel keeper. Tennessee native. Married to Catherine A. Long Henson in Christian, Kentucky on January 28, 1839 Father of Mariah A. Henson, William H. Henson, John O. Henson, Madison N. Henson, Jefferson Henson, Elisabeth Henson, Stokely Henson, Catherie Henson, and D Henson. Owned two enslaved persons in Christian County, Kentucky in 1840. Farmer in Crittenden County, Kentucky in 1850. Hotel keeper in Marion, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian, p. 213.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden, District 1, p. 217A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden, Marion (West Half), p. 405.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Christian County Marriages, Film 001942963, p. 160.
